paper_abstract: This paper investigates the stiffness characteristics of spherical parallel manipulators. By virtue of singular value decomposition, the 6 x 6 dimensionally inhomogeneous Cartesian stiffness matrix is transformed into two homogeneous ones, i.e., the rotational and translational stiffness matrices. The decomposed singular values and the corresponding vectors indicate the directions of high/weak stiffness and the stiffness isotropy for the manipulator at a given configuration. Two indices, one for rotation and the other for translation, are introduced to optimize the manipulator stiffness and to map the stiffness isocontours over the workspace to show an image of the overall stiffness.
paper_title: Stiffness Analysis and Optimization of a Co-axial Spherical Parallel Manipulator
